description.en: Eight-stage ladder from fragmentation to integrated intelligence.

definition.en: Universal Evolutionary Stages identify a recurring developmental sequence from pre-structural fragmentation through architectural standardization, semantic coherence, contextual adaptation, and ultimately to integrated intelligenceâ€”common across different domains of complexity.

principles.name: Stage 0-2: Foundation Building
principles.description: Initially progressing from operational fog (fragmented, undocumented activity) through basic digitization to simple workflow automation, with emphasis on capturing and connecting information.

principles.name: Stage 3-5: Architectural Coherence
principles.description: Advancing from scripted integration to structured data modeling and then semantic business logic, with focus on standardization, unified modeling, and consistent interpretation.

principles.name: Stage 6-8: Adaptive Intelligence
principles.description: Evolving from composable services through contextual intelligence to adaptive systems, enabling flexible recombination, context-aware operation, and continuous learning.

principles.name: Implementation Focus Shift
principles.description: As organizations progress through stages, emphasis shifts from component improvements to interface standardization and ultimately to architectural evolution.
